topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5488fb48636872046cd20200#post_5488fb48636872046cd20200
The only thing more amazing than that is how little anyone cares.

In all seriousness that might have been kinda cool if not for Watch_Dogs really not being very much more than an utterly generic open world game and Assassin's Creed honestly burning out for me about a couple hours into III when I realized that holy shit did I just not care about anything happening in it.

Also: Far Cry 2, 3, and 4 might also take place in the same universe since I recall a couple Abstergo labs set up for you to explore in 3.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5488fb6c6368726b3a050200#post_5488fb6c6368726b3a050200
The timeline of Watchdogs intersects in Assassin's Creed 4.

The CEO of Abstergo Entertainment, Olivier Garneau went missing when he traveled to Chicago, the same place Watchdogs took place. There, he was knocked out by the Aiden Pearce, the protagonist of Watchdogs (technically, you). If you look at his unconscious body, the name is similar and the occupation is "CEO of Abstergo Entertainment".
